thread.title: One dead after swimmers swept down Waikato River near Lake Taupo
thread.title_full: One dead after swimmers swept down Waikato River near Lake Taupo

title: One dead after swimmers swept down Waikato River near Lake Taupo
text:
One dead after swimmers swept down Waikato River near Lake Taupo Last updated 14:55, February 6 2017 STEPH RANGI 
People look down on the Waikato River at Aratiatia Dam where a person is missing. 
One person has died after a four people were swept down the Waikato River near Taupo. 
It is understood three women and one man aged in their 20s were swimming in the river when water released from the Aratiatia Dam swept them away. 
Two of the three that made it ashore have been transported to Taupo Hospital with moderate injuries . Supplied 
The Aratiatia Rapids north of Taupo where up to four people were swept away on Waitangi Day. 
The search continues for the fourth person. 
Huka Falls River Cruise worker, who doesn't wish to be named, said the dam will be closed for the rest of Monday. 
Mercury, formerly Mighty River Power, opens the Aratiatia Dam floodgates upstream several times a day during summer at 10am, midday, 2pm and 4pm. 
Police were alerted that the group were in trouble at 12.10pm. 
Aratiatia Power Station is a hydroelectric power station on the Waikato River, and is located 13 kilometres downstream of Lake Taupo. 
More soon.
